### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

In Windows Core:

```
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri https://aka.ms/sqlpackage-linux -OutFile ./temp/sqlpackage-linux.zip
Expand-Archive -Path ./temp/sqlpackage-linux.zip -DestinationPath ./temp/linux
Copy-Item (Join-Path ./temp/linux "*") lib -Exclude (Get-ChildItem lib -Recurse) -Recurse
```

### Expected behavior

```console
Copies the file
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Copy-Item: C:\github\dbatools-library\build\build-core.ps1:98
Line |
  98 |  Copy-Item (Join-Path ./temp/linux "*") lib -Exclude (Get-ChildItem li …
     |  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | The target file 'C:\github\dbatools-library\lib\sqlpackage' is a directory, not a
     | file.
```

comments.body: Happens in Linux too, what? Oh, oops! There was indeed a mkdir that made the sqlpackage dir in the script.

title: Windows Core `Copy-Item` falsely believes file without extension is a directory
